author: jerenkrantz
msg: Issue #94: Follow up to r1717 to not break the generic reset_connection path -
eg, when the server sends Connection: Close.
* outgoing.c
(read_from_connection): If we see ECONNRESET/ECONNABORTED or
SERF_ERROR_REQUEST_LOST, pass those errors upstream iff no responses have
been successful on this connection.
(serf_process_connection): Back out the POLLIN portion from r1717.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: * CHANGES: Add an article.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: * CHANGES: Denote fix.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Merge r1717 and add a CHANGES entry.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Issue #94: If we get a hangup on a connection that has never delivered a good
response, return an error upstream stopping an infinite loop possibility.
(Chances are we'll try twice if the connection was previously good; but when we
reset the connection and try again, we'll stop after the second time as the new
connection never resulted in a successful response.)
* outgoing.c
(serf__process_connection): Handle the two reset connection code paths.
* serf.h
(SERF_ERROR_ABORTED_CONNECTION): New error code.
* context.c
(serf_error_string): Understand the new aborted code.
